result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. VERNON F CERNEY JR

defendant.name: CERNEY, VERNON F, JR
defendant.address: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody.  Atty Scott Nelson appears in court, with the defendant on 2022CF124 and appears as a courtesy appearance on 2022CF149. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF124 & 2022CF149. 2022CF149-Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set - $2,500 cash and condition. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

2022CF124 - Attorney Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 2:43 PM

Court will set 2022CF149 for Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 1:00 PM (1/2 hr).  2022CF124 is to track with.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:32 AM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. State has one witness.

Taylor Wallace sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed by Green Lake County Sheriff's Office as a Patrol Deputy. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Venue established. Identified the defendant present in court. No cross exam. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court will set for Arraignment on September 13, 2022 at 2:15 PM

Court adjourned at 8:38 AM.

1:09 PM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over prelim scheduled for tomorrow - 08/02. Court goes over right to counsel and no attorney at this time. Statement by the defendant, re-applied for PD representation and does qualify. Prelim for 08/02 will proceed.

Court adjourned at 1:12 PM
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes bond has been set - $1,000 cash bond & condition. Statement by the defendant, requests a bond modification. Court orders bond to remain as is. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on August 2, 2022 at 8:30 AM and Status Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

1:03 PM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody and via video.  Attorney Michael Kapelis present in court. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause. Court questions defendant regarding address. ADA makes bond recommendation.
